Identifier: Carreras-Gallo (2023) - Impact of tobacco, alcohol, and
Covariates: sex, age, ethnicity, body mass index (BMI), level of education, alcohol and tobacco consumption (except when they were the variable of interest), slide, cell type, and surrogate variables.

Identifier: Chen (2017) - An epigenome-wide association study
Covariates: age, sex, asthma, batch (or plate), population subgroup (in GALA II) and the first five principal components (PCs) of the genotypic data, cell-types

Identifier: Dugue (2019) - Alcohol consumption is associated with
Covariates: former, <15 years ago; current, <20 cigarettes per day; current, ≥20 cigarettes per day), body mass index (BMI) (≤25, >25 to ≤30, and >30 kg/m2), country of birth (Australia/New Zealand, Italy, Greece, UK), sample type (peripheral blood mononuclear cells, dried blood spots, buffy coats), and white blood cell composition (percentage of CD4+ T cells, CD8+ T cells, B cells, NK cells, monocytes, and granulocytes, estimated using the Houseman algorithm27), and random effects for study, plate, and chip

Identifier: Everson (2015) - DNA methylation loci associated with
Covariates: cell-type proportions and sex

Identifier: Gondolia (2019) - Methylome-wide association study provides
Covariates:
stratified by cohort and race/ethnicity (African-, European-, and Hispanic/
Latinx-American) and adjusted for age (years) at blood draw, education (high school
education or lower, more than high school), smoking status (current, former, never), alcohol
use (current, former, never), physical activity (metabolic equivalent of task [MET-hours/
week]), body mass index (BMI, kg/m2
), neighborhood socioeconomic status (Roux et al.,
2001), mean temperature (°C), mean dew point (°C), mean barometric pressure (kPa),
season, and methylation-related variables, which included ten principal components (PCs)
for genetic ancestry (when available), leukocyte proportions, and technical covariates.
Analyses additionally controlled for cohort-specific covariates, including binary sex (male,
female) in ARIC; randomly assigned treatment group (CT subpopulations of WHI-AS311,
WHI-BAA23, WHI-EMPC); case-control status (WHI-AS311, WHI-BAA23); and control
matching criteria (WHI-AS311).

Identifier: Hannon (2016) - An integrated genetic-epigenetic analysis
Covariates: age, gender, and cell composition

Identifier: Joehanes (2016) - Epigenetic Signatures of Cigarette Smoking
Covariates: sex age blood count, technical covariates

Identifier: Joubert (2017) - DNA Methylation in Newborns and
Covariates: maternal age, maternal education (or a surrogate socioeconomic metric), parity, and technical covariates such as batch or plate

Identifier: Kupers (2019) - Meta-analysis of epigenome-wide
Covariates: gestational age at delivery, child sex, maternal age at delivery, parity (0/≥1), smoking during pregnancy (no smoking/stopped in early pregnancy/smoking throughout pregnancy), pre-pregnancy BMI, socio-economic position, technical variation, and estimated white blood cell proportions (B-cells, CD8+ T-cells, CD4+ T-cells, granulocytes, NK-cells and monocytes)

Identifier: Liu (2018) - A DNA methylation biomarker of
Covariates: age, sex, body mass index, technical covariates and white blood cell counts; ge (continuous), sex, smoking status (never; former, ≥15 years ago

Identifier: Mendelson (2017) - Association of Body Mass Index
Covariates: age, sex, family relatedness (random effect), and surrogate variables (to account for differential cell proportions and technical effects

Identifier: Peng (2019) - Epigenome-wide association study reveals
Covariates: maternal covariates [age at enrollment (continuous), smoking status (never, former, or during pregnancy), education (college/graduate level or not college/graduate level), atopy history (asthma, eczema or hay fever)], child covariates [sex (female or male), race/ethnicity (white, black or others), gestational age (continuous)], and cell type proxies estimated for peripheral blood (percentages of monocytes, CD8T cells, CD4T cells, NK cells, and B cells).

Identifier: Portales-Casamar (2016) - DNA methylation signature of human
Covariates: clinical status, SVs

Identifier: Qi (2020) - Nasal DNA methylation profiling of
Covariates: age, sex, batch, study center, and surrogate variables

Identifier: Reese (2019) - Epigenome-wide meta-analysis of
Covariates: maternal age, sustained maternal smoking during pregnancy, maternal asthma, socioeconomic status, and child's sex. Cohorts adjusted for batch effects by using ComBat or SVA or by including a batch covariate in their models.

Covariates: maternal age, maternal education, maternal smoking status, technica covariates, cord blood reference panel

Identifier: Sikdar (2019) - Comparison of smoking-related DNA
Covariates: age (continuous), sex and cell-type proportion, batch effects

Covariates: sex, cohort, and technical covariables

Covariates: 15 PCs, array, gender, age, cell-type
